text: [Music]
Alaska's northerly polar location places
the state close to Russia Asia and even
Europe any missiles fired at the US
would likely pass this way
it's a lesser distance for a missile to
impact the United States if it comes
over Alaska than it does if it were say
to follow the equator but what's the
military secret weapon for detecting an
incoming nuclear threat from thousands
of miles away I see one valid missile
the sophisticated machine responsible
for keeping our nation safe stands ten
stories tall it has two 90-foot wide
array faces and can see more than 3,000
miles into space this is the a sparse
solid-state phased array radar system
during World War two big advances and
radar technology produced systems
capable of detecting large aircraft
hundreds of miles away but today the
biggest threat is a nuclear missile
which can be launched from half a world
away and s bars can spot them long
before they threatened US soil the fact
that we can detect and track an object
as small as a basketball at several
thousand miles is just exciting how does
the s bars pull off this extraordinary
feat we are sending out a radio wave
into space and it hits a reflective
object then it comes back and so the
computer knows when it sent it out at
times it when it comes back it's like
okay I sent something out there unlike
regular radar which uses a dish to sweep
the skies the s bars has no moving parts
instead on each of its phases it has
approximately 1,800 small fixed antennae
that steer the radio waves
electronically the S bars can precisely
scan the entire width of a 240 degree
field in less than the blink of an eye
